comments.body: Crazy work with the toys
This is a really cool and cute idea, and gives a good reason to live in the Nether for extended periods of time!
it doesn't really sound like Minecraft more like some anime mod

And be able to use wool as fuel on a furnace.
please yes
what if you can only make wool into string on a loom like real life instead of a crafting table?

Similar idea, hope its good;

A balloon made out of phantom membrane and wool that attaches to mobs like leads and has a stack size of ~16.
If one is attached to a boat, minecart, donkey, or tamed pig; It becomes a pilotable blimp.
Attaching one to a mob would incapacitate it and lift it somewhere between 1-3 blocks from the altitude it was equipped at.

Attacking a balloon will lower it's altitude by the amount of damage delt to it. Once whatever it's carrying lands via balloon damage, the balloon is itemized. If the attack is piercing like an arrow or spear; it's immediately itemized.

If a blimp-rider needs more altitude, at some point they would need to apply a second balloon for the initial lift that comes with it. For that to work; I think left-clicking or "using" the deployed balloon should place it directly into your inventory instead of itemizing for fear of dropping it.

Shift-left-clicking or "sneaking, then using" would attach one onto the player, lifting, incapacitating, but also for parachuting down steep ledges.
...so boat+happy ghast+lead?
Blimps or balloons, yes. But only once we get the furnace cart in Bedrock and three-player canoes and four-person sailboats.
Yes except that‚Äôs too easy to get
Its true cuz i was trying 2 use a blaze rod with daimaiond it can work
I would love a little bit (mod) tinkers construct DNA in the basegame so that we can make personalized tools and weapons! They also need to add more weapontypes, ammotypes.
This would add another layer of customization. I like it!

I thought about that too. However, I trashed the idea because lightning storms don't happen often enough. Maybe a copper item could be added that makes the weather turn to thunder? Or another item that can store lightning strikes outside of a storm for use on your copper items?

Yeah they should be buffed to encourage the use. But rising up the enchantment caps only for them leaves some tricky problems for enchanted books. Do we have to combine 4 Fortune III to get Fortune V? If enchanted books with Fortune V exists, what if we apply it to a netherite pickaxe? How could early-game players to get so many enchanted books to get such high tier enchantment?

My idea is to make copper items get better enchantments from enchantment table. Just like golden items are trash in durability, but they are way more likely to get higher tier enchantments from the enchantment table compared to other items. Similar buff could also be applied to copper items. I'd suggest copper items are guaranteed to get high-tier enchantments from that. To be exactly, once an enchantment is rolled for the given copper item, it's always the highest tier (like when Fortune is rolled, it's always Fortune III, Fortune I or II never appear). More bookshelves nearby makes it more likely to have multiple enchantments rolled. This could make copper the strategic choice for early-game players who prioritize powerful enchants over durability.
I think this would be a great fit for gold! Copper being early to midgame though I'd rather it offered something different than having to grind for XP

I think an overcharged effect would be intersenting thought it should probably also have a l limit on times it can be used maybe something like once the tool has been struck by lightning it gets a an idditonal +4 damage and +2 per piece of metal armour target is wearing. but only applies once before returning to be used as a regular sword (maybe using like 10/20 duriablity?). making effective for surprise attacks? also maybe copper gear acting  a bit like a lightning rod pulling the strikes to you and giving some amount of lightning protection and charging a copper sword if caring it?
It is perfect because they are powerful it makes sense to not happen all the time!

(I'm the one who created this post) Here are some more of my ideas: Wool golem, All of the categories need to be visible, Hive golem, Dragon skin material, Quartz golem, Giant flying fish (It's not as weird as it sounds), Bring back the mob vote (but much better than before), Ancient mob for the nether, Ancient mob for the end, Enderite (for easier transportation), Wild golem (grows plants), Copper golems should be able to wear armor, Copper golems should be a bit less strict about sorting, Copper golems should become charged when struck by lightning, Water blaze/breeze. The "Bryze", Ground blaze/breeze. The "boaze", I know that that's a lot of ideas, but please still check them out. (if you didn't like this idea, that doesn't mean that you won't like my other ideas)
